critique: The document focuses on national defense and the need to complete highway construction quickly. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of reassurance and confidence in the government's ability to protect the nation. There's also an element of urgency and perhaps a touch of fear regarding the potential consequences of not completing the projects on time. The mention of overtime pay aims to mitigate potential anger or resentment from laborers. Surprise and disgust are not really relevant here.
